ï¼´ã€€ï¼¡ã€€ï¼®ã€€ï¼¡ã€€ï¼³ã€€ï¼©ã€€ï¼®ã€€ï¼®
Site rules
In order for this website to be able to function, there are some rules that you will have to follow while using it.

Be friendly.

The internet is a network that connects people using computers. The other endpoint is a human being with an inner life just as complex as your own. Act accordingly.
Consider the reach of the posts you make. Tag content that you expect others might not want to see.
Harassment and bullying of any kind are not tolerated here. Do not engage with a user if they do not want you to. Do not ask other users to, either.

Donâ€™t start shit.

Do not make posts just to get angry reactions.
â€œI was being ironicâ€ is an extremely flimsy excuse for behaving badly.
Do not drag unrelated people into a discussion.

Obey the law.

Specifically, Dutch (server location) and German (owner location) law.
No illegal file sharing, no illegal pornography, no publication of personal protected information, no holocaust denial, you know the drill.

Spam is not allowed.

Bots that interact with a user without a users explicit request are not allowed.
Automated or excessive advertising is not allowed.

Be aware of the nature of the network.

This website is part of a network of similar websites. Other websites may have different rules.
The local administration has little control over users of other websites. You can, however, block and mute them - same as local users.
In egregious cases, remote users or entire groups of users may be blocked from interacting with users of this website.

Fascism is incompatible with a free exchange of ideas.

When you endorse racism, exclusion and the structural and physical violence that come with it, you show yourself to not be interested in any sort of dialogue.
Those who work towards a society based on chauvinism and nationalism rather than peaceful coexistance are not welcome here.

Admin decisions are final.

The interpretation of these rules is up to the administration and an admins decision overrides the rules.
â€œTechnically I did not violate any ruleâ€ is an extremely flimsy excuse for behaving badly.
The rules may be changed or amended when necessary.

These goal of these rules is to ensure a safe and welcoming environment.

Rule enforcement is guided by this goal.
Any enforcement action will generally be kept between those involved.
Try to self-moderate, but do not hesitate to involve an admin when necessary.
There are presently two people with administrative access to the website, @halcy, @dotUser .
You can report rule violations via the report function, or via e-mail.
You can find information about our
terms of service and privacy policy here.

aboutMore:
As a community platform, we hope and strive for constructive interaction with one another and the broader mastodon community.
Community platforms have an obligation to maintain an environment conducive to community. For this reason, participation may be subject to moderation. The following guidelines are are here to provide you with an insight into MSP Social content moderation policies and, therefore, the type of community we strive to promote. Ideally nobody will ever have to actively interveneâ€“instead, people who find these guidelines unacceptable are encouraged to find someplace else to be.
The following uses are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
Sexual depictions of children
Advocating Nazis/White Nationalism
Any intentional, reckless, or negligent conduct that results in: stalking or harassing other users, or impeding other users from utilizing the service, or degrading the performance of the service, or inciting others to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
Conversation with or conduct directed at a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
Racism or advocation of racism
Sexism or advocation of sexism
Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism
The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
Excessive advertising
Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
The above guidelines notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
Unavailable content
Mastodon generally allows you to view content from and interact with users from any other server in the fediverse. These are the exceptions that have been made on this particular server.
Media files from these servers will not be processed or stored, and no thumbnails will be displayed, requiring manual click-through to the original file:

Since "Be excellent to each other" is much easier said than done, we have a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, and silencing or suspension of accounts, if problems persist. In particular, we do not tolerate:
Harrassment, stalking, doxxing
Racism, sexism, verbal abuse or advocation thereof
Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
Violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism
Contacting people who made clear they want no contact. Dogpiling/brigading
Untagged sexual content, gore, or advertisement
Untagged, or automated, or excessive advertisement
Bots interacting with users without their explicit requests
Please report behaviour that bothers you. That includes behaviour from other instances - we are very willing stop federating with asshole instances.

Github-repository
.
Moderated servers

name: LGBT.io
aboutMore:
Code of Conduct
The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of lgbt.io; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
Excessive advertising
Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
Racism or advocation of racism
Sexism or advocation of sexism
Casteism or advocation of casteism
Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
Sexual depictions of children
Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

Crossposting from other services is currently permitted, with certain conditions:
If crossposting
from
Twitter, those toots must be posted as Unlisted or Followers-only.

Accounts on lgbt.io are expected to be created with the intention of interacting with the community in some way. Accounts which demonstrate being used primarily under automation or for crossposting may be suspended.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
-- Code of Conduct (obtained from mastodon.social and modified by lgbt.io) last updated on 10th December 2020.

Staff
In addition to the site's owner,
@self
, lgbt.io's moderation staff include:

@codeawayhaley

@porsupah

-- If you are interested in becoming a moderator on lgbt.io, feel free to contact
@self
.

About this instance
Colorid.es (from colorides, "colorful people") is an instance focused on the queer/LGBTQIAPN+ community. Anyone can make an account, but don't be surprised if you encounter few het, cis and perisex people here. We take our rules serioulsy, so please read that section before making an account.
Also, this is an instance primarily for Portuguese speakers. People who don't speak Portuguese or who will also speak in other languages are welcome, though, as long as our moderation team can handle it!
We include people who are queer, intersex, transgender, nonbinary, multi-oriented (m-spec), heteroflexible, asexual spectrum, aromantic spectrum, fluid, xenogender, polygender, agender spectrum, non-het regarding sensual/alterous/queerplatonic orientation, astroidian, asterian, non-cis because of culture/belief/life experience, and others in the community. Your hatred for them is not tolerable regardless of your own identity, and will result on a ban.
This instance's moderation team has the right of deleting any toot (post) or account, if we notice it's causing the community more harm than good. See the rules to know more.
If you don't think this instance is for you,
take a look at this list
or
this one
to find other good servers.

Our rules
0. This instance's moderation/administration staff reserves the right to delete any toot (post) or account, and the right to block/silence any instance, if we decide those are doing more harm than good to the community.
This usually applies to posts/users/instances that break the following rules, but may also apply to cases which are unaccounted for.
1. Anything against Brazilian law is not allowed here.
2. Everything posted by you is your responsibility.

If someone else goes against the rules on your account, you are the one who should be more careful next time.
If you post anything that's against the law, this is not the responsibility of colorid.es' staff.
If you do anything against the rules of this instance on another account, your account may still be punished.

3. Bigoted and/or annoying attitudes won't be tolerated.

There is a limit between contributing to oppression on accident because of society's default views and insisting on contributing to oppression because you think certain opinions are "not a big deal" or "common sense".
There is a limit between asking questions and insisting on not understanding why something is bad to a certain group of people.
There is a limit between joking around without knowing someone could get offended and insisting on "joking around" because "it's not serious".
There is a limit between wanting to express oneself and posting many repetitive and/or short messages with essentially no new content. If you want to spam, use the private or unlisted options.
Even if it doesn't have to do with known kinds of discrimination/oppression, try not to judge people for "strange", "ridiculous" ou "childish" behavior when it doesn't affect you. Extreme cases of this may lead to moderation action.

4. Avoid fights.

If someone is acting in bad faith, argue without resorting to vague/baseless insults, block the person and/or report them.
Even if somewhere else someone made bad decisions regarding a person or group, here is not the place to plan "raids" against other spaces.
If someone exposes a way to communicate with someone that did something problematic, don't think it's a good idea to send messages with violent suggestions to them. If such messages come from this instance, we may take action against this on here.

5. Use content warnings when necessary.
Content that needs labeling includes:
Politics (as in elections and government decisions)
Blood/gore/violence
Sexual content or content with sexual connotations
Abuse, bullying, suicide, stalking, eugenicism and other negative situations people may want to avoid reading or seeing images about, especially because of their own past experiences
Discussions or warnings about epidemics, pandemics and natural disasters (or other similar dangerous events such as fires) that are ongoing or in recent memory
Discussion or mentions of incest
Negative experiences regarding discrimination (racism, ableism, misogyny, dyadism, heterosexism, cissexism, exorsexism, monossexism, antisemitism, xenomisia, classism, whoremisia, against non-monogamous people, etc.)
Alcohol/drugs
Spoilers regarding media that has been out for less than 7 days:
If such media is a videogame, a movie, an episode of a reality show/cartoon/series, a book/text/video/audio which contains a fictional or real story that may be "spoiled" if someone tells its development or ending: content warnings for spoilers are mandatory;
If such media is an ad, an academic publication, a journalistic article/show, or a video/text/audio/image that's meant to be informative and that doesn't contain any story that may be "spoiled" if its development or ending is told: content warnings for spoilers aren't needed, unless such media spoils something that applies to the item above;
If such media doesn't fit either or fits both of the descriptions above, use common sense. And if you still aren't sure, maybe put the content inside a spoiler content warning anyways.


It's not mandatory to use content warnings for other kinds of contents or subjects, but we recommend using them as much as you think it's worth it. See what other people content warn, for instance.
6. If you want to make an account with the purpose of posting automated content ("bot"), advertising or other kinds of "borderline against the rules" content, please contact the staff beforehand, so we can tell you how you can proceed.

7. Don't steal content, and respect artists'/creators' wishes.
Details:
If someone doesn't want their content to be reposted, don't repost it.
Unless the content is explicitly marked as something that doesn't need attribution (such as public domain content), every book/song citation, video, image (including avatar/header), ASCII art, etc. needs to be credited, either by a link to the artist's profile, a link to somewhere that properly attributes the content or by citing an artist's name and/or the work's name, unless the work is your own.
If an artist asks you to remove their art from your profile or avatar, you'll have to remove it.

Instances with completely different rules than ours may be blocked. However, slight rule differences (with regards to content warnings for certain things, for instance) may be tolerated. Be careful while navigating the global timeline.

Rassismus wird nicht toleriert, ebenso wie Sexismus, Beschimpfungen, sowie Diskriminierung von Minderheiten jeglicher Art.

  Ausgenommen von dieser Regelung sind gemeinschaftlich betreute Accounts, sowie Crossposts anderer Netzwerke von lokalem Interesse.
Nutzer_innen mit (sehr) hohen Beitrags-Frequenzen sollten ihre BeitrÃ¤ge auf ungelistet stellen, um die lokale Zeitleiste nicht zu Ã¼berschwemmen.

Bots dÃ¼rfen nur mit Nutzer_innen interagieren, wenn diese dazu eingeladen wurden.

Anwendungsbereich

name: Too Many Cooks

table.Reason: lots of shitposting, sudden influx of what appear to be bad-faith users
lots of shitposting, sudden influx of what appear to be bad-faith users
created for the purpose of ban evasion / abuse

aboutMore:
Welcome to Too Many Cooks! An instance for those who love to make and/or eat food!
Your friendly neighborhood admin is
@mdszy
We run glitch-soc with a character limit of 5000 to make it easier to post full recipes and such!
Instance-specific rules
Content Warning Policy

CW'ing of food is not required! Any post made on the instance without a CW will have the CW "auto cw: could contain food" when it federates. However, the post will appear non-CW'd on this instance itself. This allows us to not have to CW and click through every post, while still protecting folks on other instances who wish to have food content behind a CW.

However,
cursed
food (i.e. food posts that are meant as humor and would probably be considered gross)
must
be CW'd.

CW'ing of meat or non-vegan content is recommended.
Cocktails/homebrewing are incredibly valid forms of cooking too! However, please CW alcohol-related content appropriately.

Other Instance-specific policies.

The best way to cook, bake, eat or otherwise enjoy something is
the way that specific person enjoys it
. That is, gatekeeping will not be tolerated.
This instance is for folks who cook/bake/etc. of all skill levels! Do not disparage beginners. Be respectful and helpful.
Do not use any method of crossposting from Twitter or other social networks to Too Many Cooks.
Signups are approval-only. This is to prevent spam. If applicable, please mention any other fedi account you might consider your "main" to make approvals easier.

All around rules

No advertising or excessive promotion.
No bots without prior approval.
No pornography.
No gore or graphic violence.
Food preparation involving raw meat could be considered an exception to this. Always CW content of this kind.
Content that is NSFW or borderline NSFW must be put behind a CW.
No racism, sexism, ableism, transphobia, nationalism, fascism, or sympathizing with or advocating for any of these things or related things.
No Nazis or related symbolism.
Respect boundaries. If someone asks you to stop interacting with them, stop. If someone blocks or mutes you, do not attempt to evade that action in any way.
No stalking, harassment, dogpiling or any other action that is meant to intimidate anyone.
Any other unethical content is disallowed and will be left to the discretion of the admin(s).
Just don't be a dingus.
Do not scrape any content from the web interface or API.

Reporting
It is best to err on the side of reporting content you think may be breaking rules. Reports will be kept anonymous. Do not, however, make bad-faith reports or spam reports on clearly non-rule-breaking posts. Feel free to report content that isn't on the instance itself, but that appears on the Federated timeline and would be considered breaking our rules.
Federation policies
We do not federate with overtly fascist instances or instances that associate with them. Feel free to let the admins know if you have a problem with this policy so they can defederate with you, too.
Privacy Reminders

This instance uses HTTPs everywhere thanks to Let's Encrypt.
New users of the site are opted out of search engine indexing by default. Note that this relies on the search engine itself respecting this setting, so it's not foolproof.
No ads, trackers or analytics of any kind are used on Too Many Cooks.
Understand that this instance admins have access to all data submitted to, and all data that federates with this site. Data is not encrypted, this includes followers-only and DM posts.

Media Storage
This isn't so much a rules section as it is thanking Jortage for providing the media storage for the instance!


Moderated servers
Mastodon generally allows you to view content from and interact with users from any other server in the fediverse. These are the exceptions that have been made on this particular server.

name: gamemaking.social
aboutMore:
Rules and Expected Conduct

I (and any other admins or moderators who may be added later) will do my best to provide a place where people can feel comfortable and not harassed. However due to the nature of the
Fediverse
I can not guarantee a
safespace
.
To do this I expect that people use content warnings following the usual Mastodon etiquette; for example for politics, 'adult'/lewd content, eye contact, food, mental health ... if in doubt ask first please!
I frequently check the local and federated timelines to make sure the rules are kept to, and block and silence instances who do not meet my expectations. I also monitor behaviour from other instance accounts so that I can block and silence preventatively.
There is no tolerance for harassment or discrimination of any kind, directly or indirectly. For example, this includes racism, ableism, homophobia, transphobia and TERF shit, fascism, general channer garbage, and so on.
Respect each others' privacy choices.
Please remember that the Anglophone web is not the USA, and that others' will have different cultural expectations and practices. Let's all respect each others'.
NB: This isn't meant as a dog whistle, just trying to say that just because something aint offensive in one place doesn't mean it aint a problem elsewhere.
Always remember that we're here to encourage and support each other, and hopefully make pals (and make videogames less bad)!
If you make an account that's just for promoting your game without any interest in engaging with other people (IE SPAM) I will very probably delete it.

Other Guidelines and Notes

gamemaking.social does not claim ownership of anything you post. You retain full rights.
Account deletion by owners is enabled.
There's no Google stuff or anything else gross. In your adblocker you'll just need to make sure gamemaking.social and cf.mastohost.com (media storage) are allowed.
We're hosted on
masto.host
, on the 'niche' plan. I believe the servers are in so-called Canada and France.
Admin accounts are:
@blueberrysoft
and
@gamemakingtools
.
Don't forget to make an
#introductions
post :D
In the event of me wanting to abandon owning this instance I will happily pass it on to a new admin :)

Moderated servers
Mastodon generally allows you to view content from and interact with users from any other server in the fediverse. These are the exceptions that have been made on this particular server.

name: myasstodon.xyz
aboutMore:
Our Goal
This community is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form.
Applicability and Scope
This code of conduct applies to all of this community's spaces, including public channels, private channels and direct messages, both online and off. Anyone who violates this code of conduct may be sanctioned or expelled from these spaces at the discretion of the administrators.
Toward a Welcoming and Safe Environment
We hope to create an environment in which diverse individuals can collaborate and interact in a positive and affirming way. Examples of behavior that contributes to creating this sort of environment include:
* Using welcoming and inclusive language
* Being respectful of differing viewpoints and experiences
* Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
* Focusing on what is best for the overall community
* Showing empathy towards other community members
Anti-Harassment Statement
This community will not tolerate harassment of any kind. Examples of harassment include:
* Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, pregnancy status, veteran status, political affiliation, marital status, body size, age, race, national origin, ethnic origin, nationality, immigration status, language, religion or lack thereof, or other identity marker. This includes anti-Indigenous/Nativeness and anti-Blackness.
* Unwelcome comments regarding a person's lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, relationships, drugs, and employment.
* Deliberate misgendering, using inappropriate pronouns, or use of "dead" or rejected names.
* Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behavior in spaces where they're not appropriate.
* Physical contact and simulated physical contact (eg, textual descriptions like "hug" or "backrub") without consent or after a request to stop.
* Threats of violence.
* Incitement of violence towards any individual or group, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm.
* Deliberate intimidation.
* Stalking or following - online or in the physical world.
* Harassing photography or recording, including logging online activity for harassment purposes.
* Sustained disruption of discussion.
* Unwelcome sexual attention.
* Patterns of inappropriate social contact, such as requesting/assuming inappropriate levels of intimacy with others.
* Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease.
* Deliberate "outing" of any aspect of a person's identity without their consent except as necessary to protect vulnerable people from intentional abuse.
* Publication of non-harassing private communication.
* Jokes that resemble the above, such as "hipster racism", still count as harassment even if meant satirically or ironically.
If you have questions or concerns about these issues please feel free to message an admin or ask for an opportunity to explore the issue with a moderator and volunteers.
Reporting
If you are being harassed by a member of our community, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact the administrators @ldopa or @jackdaw_ruiz via Direct Message (DM). If the person who is harassing you is on the admin team, they will not be involved in handling or resolving the incident.
The admin team will respond to any complaint as promptly as possible we can. If you do not get a timely response (for example, if no admins are currently online) then please put your personal safety and well-being first, and consider logging out and/or contacting the admins by email at admin@myasstodon.xyz.
This code of conduct applies to our community's spaces, but if you are being harassed by a member of our community outside our spaces, we still want to know about it. We will take all good-faith reports of harassment by our members, especially the administrators, seriously. This includes harassment outside our spaces and harassment that took place at any point in time. The abuse team reserves the right to exclude people from the community based on their past behavior, including behavior outside of our spaces and behavior towards people who are not in this community.
In order to protect volunteers from abuse and burnout, we reserve the right to reject any report we believe to have been made in bad faith. Reports intended to silence legitimate criticism may be deleted without response.
Enforcement Process
Every code of conduct violation report will be treated with seriousness and care. If a member's immediate safety and security is threatened, an individual admin may take any action that they deem appropriate, up to and including temporarily banning the offender from the community. In less urgent situations, at least two admins will discuss the offense and mutually arrive at a suitable response, which will be shared with the offender privately. Whatever the resolution that they decide upon, the decision of the admins involved in a violation case will be considered final.
We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom we've received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them, if we believe that doing so will increase the safety of our members or the general public. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.
Consequences
Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately. If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the administrators may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from the community and identification of the participant as a harasser to other members. At the discretion of the admins, or by request, one or more of the parties involved may request to discuss the violation and how to avoid similar situations in the future.
Acknowledgements
This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Community Covenant (http://community-covenant.net), version 1.0, available at http://community-covenant.net/version/1/0/. The Community Covenant is an open source effort and is built on codes of conduct that came before it, including the Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org/) and the LGBTQ in Tech community code of conduct (http://lgbtq.technology/coc.html).
License
Community Covenant by Coraline Ada Ehmke is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/). Based on a work at http://community-covenant.net/.

Welcome !
This is an open Mastodon instance, basically.
It's run by the person you see on the right (that's me!) and for now, that's all.
There might be more admins and moderators later if the needs come but alas not yet.
We run
Mastodon Glitch Edition
.
I hope this instance works okay for you, and that you can find a nice and welcoming community here! Feel free to hit me up if you have any questions or requests, be it about this instance, how to make your own instance, or other things not related to Mastodon.
I am actually the only sysadmin of this instance and I can't work full-time on oldbytes.space so, I will do whatever I can in a reasonable time to make it works the best it can.
Rules
This instance has some rules, of course.
First, the usual : no sexism, no racism, no hate speech, no LGBTQphobia, no nazis, no spam, no public unflagged porn, etc...
Then, I also believe it's important to remind you that this server was made and is being run by a queer activist.
This server thrives to be inclusive, and I will ban without much regret.
People are encouraged to use the report function as they see fit, and can be confident that their complaints will be heard and dealt with in some way. I want everyone to feel safe here, and if that doesn't sound like something you like, you should probably find another server.
There's also a pretty important activism aspect of this instance.
If you're a marketer, or a #digital #influencer, this is not the place for you. Not only do I feel you should not feel welcome, I intend to make you feel definitely NOT welcome.
This instance, and this entire social network in my opinion, is dedicated to reclaiming social media, decentralizing, and generally creating better and more engaging communities.
The three categories of people I mentioned earlier are not, in my opinion, working towards this goal, pretty much the opposite, and they are not welcome on this server.
Please report them if you see them.
We also block Nazis, techbros and RMS.
Specs
Currently running on
Hetzner Cloud
hardware.
One CX31-CEPH with Nginx, Mastodon WEB, Mastodon Sidekiq and Minio as a S3 assets manager endpoint, PostgreSQL and Redis.
You can take a look at the Grafana (Telegraf) graphs metrics
HERE
.
Backups are taken one time per day using the dedicated paid option of Hetzner.

Terms
The server is hosted in Falkenstein
The only logs created are the ones from: nginx, mastodon (nodejs, puma web server, sidekiq) and minio (assets).
There is no retention currently in place except the by-default on Debian.

aboutMore:
AllPro Rules:


Put your pronouns in your bio, CW lewd stuff, and donâ€™t be a jerk!

Sports are competitive and rivalries are great. Itâ€™s cool to have a little trash talk between rivals, but donâ€™t take it too far and donâ€™t make it personal.

Allpro is a place to discuss sports, sports related things, etc. General stuff is fine (if you're watching the game with friends, you don't *only* talk about the game after all), but try to keep on topic.

There are a lot of complicated feelings towards the names and logos of certain major league sports teams. Fans of those teams are welcome to share in the joy of sports with us, but
whenever possible, avoid the use of team names, logos, or fan chants/displays that have a history in racist stereotypes
including the nickname of Washington's NFL team and the caricature logo of Cleveland's MLB team. Usage of hashtags such as â€˜HTTRâ€™ are fine. I know mistakes will be made, but repeated or clearly intentional use will result in administrative action

if you think any of these rules encroach on your free speech, well, tough shit. Also, and I say this emphatically, if you're a Nazi, a bigot or otherwise a hate-peddler? Take a hike. We don't need or want you here.
The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of allpro.social; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
Excessive advertising
Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
Racism or advocation of racism
Sexism or advocation of sexism
Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
Sexual depictions of children
Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.


These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

aboutMore:
Code of Conduct
- No harassment or block evading. Respect other users' privacy and ability to curate their own experience online.
- No hate speech, aggressive nationalism, or right wing sympathies of any kind. This includes racism, sexism, mysoginy, homophobia, transphobia, antisemitism, casteism, white supremacy, corporate or police bootlicking, fascism, or discrimination of any kind.
- Please try your best use content warnings on your sensitive posts. Some examples of CWs: politics(pol), NSFW/lewd/kink, food/diet/weight, physical & mental health(ph & mh), weapons/violence/death, eye contact(ec), all caps, emoji spam/screen reader inaccessible.
- Do not demand CWs from other users. Block and report if you have to, but do not try to police someone else's experience. If it's a genuine problem it will fall to the mods.
- No inappropriate (sexual or otherwise) behavior towards or from individuals under the age of 18. All lewdness must be between consenting adults.
- No "brand" content. We are people here, not companies. Showing and even selling your own work is okay, as long as you're not just advertising.
- Good spam is ok
- Try to be nice to each other :)
- You are solely responsible for the consequences of anything you post, be it on here or in the real world. The final decision on if something violates the CoC will be at the discretion of the mods. This is a small instance so we prefer to talk it out to resolve conflict, but we will use administrative powers when necessary.

Support Seite
Rules
"Be excellent to each other" is easier said than done, and means different things to different people.
The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviours that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the descretion of the instance administrators.
Please report behaviour that bothers you. We will keep your report confidential.

We do not tolerate harrassment, stalking, and doxxing.
We do not tolerate racism, sexism, verbal abuse, discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or the advocation of any of these.
We do not tolerate violent nationalist propaganda, Nazi symbolism or promoting the ideology of National Socialism.
Do not contact people who made clear they want no contact. This includes dogpiling/brigading.
Posts with sexual content or gore have to be tagged.
Advertisements have to be tagged, and must not be excessive or automated.
Automated posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of our instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions.
Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
If you need to post with a high frequency, please set your posts to be unlisted to keep the local timeline readable.
In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to, and try to avoid irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language â€“ they typically don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.

name: dads.cool

table.Meaning: concerning mental health, with a - to indicate negative feelings and + for positive
the same, but with physical health
referring to a wider conversation across mastodon
political content, often localized with uspol, eupol, asiapol, etc.

aboutMore:
Hi Code of Conduct, I'm Dad!
Fatherhood is a spectrum, respect that.
dads.cool is an instance for dads; if you apply to become a user, itâ€™s expected that you have, had, or are expecting, at least one (human) childâ€”sorry, but pets are not children, no matter how much we love them. Being a father does not mean identifying or being labeled as a man, nor does it mean that you were involved in the conception of the child you take care of. Foster dads, adoptive dadsâ€”anyone who cares for a child and identifies as a dad is welcome here. In that spirit, dads.cool welcomes all sexualities, gender identities, races, levels of mobility, and ages.
If a user posts a message that mocks, harasses, endangers, threatens, or otherwise puts at risk any other person on the basis of the criteria above, they will be banned from dads.cool. There is not an appeals process.
Replying to Other Users
Sharing your experiences as a dad is what weâ€™re all here to do, but take care to distinguish between â€œthis is what worked for meâ€ and â€œthis is what you should do.â€ Whatever the intentions behind it, unsolicited adviceâ€”especially involving a user's health and wellnessâ€”is often indistinguishable from harassment and will be treated as such. This is especially true when the health or safety of children is concerned. Please ask permission before giving advice to another user.
Generally, seek to understand what a user is looking for when they post their feelings. Is it encouragement, explanation, empathy? It never hurts to ask before you post your reply.
Reporting another User
Please use the Report button on posts you feel put our community at risk (including those that might come from other instances, but are directed at dads.cool users); it is the easiest way for an admin to identify abuse.
Content Warnings
Mastodonâ€™s robust support for content warnings (CWs) is a valuable part of the platform. Please consider using CWs for images that might be considered â€œnot safe for workâ€ like nudity or sexual content, for stories of loss or injury, for video in general, and for photos with eye contact.
We do not have formal rules around what exactly should or should not be placed under a CW, but repeated posts of sensitive content without them may result in a message from an admin. Before you ask another person to CW something that is disruptive to you, consider whether one of the myriad other options for personal content moderationâ€”muting, blocking, unfollowing, or filtering wordsâ€”would achieve the result of removing that content from your own timeline.
A table of CWs in regular use around Mastodon is below:


CW
Meaning


ec
a photo with eye contact

pers
intimate or personal information

mh
concerning mental health, with a - to indicate negative feelings and + for positive

ph
the same, but with physical health

lewd
sexually suggestive content

meta
referring to a wider conversation across mastodon

pol
political content, often localized with uspol, eupol, asiapol, etc.


Instance Blocks
dads.cool implements the open source "BLOCKchain" to block interactions with instances that might put our community at risk. Detailed reasons behind each ban can be found
on the list's GitHub page.
dads.cool will not federate with any instance associated with the white supremacist platform Gab. dads.cool will not federate with any multi-user instance that lacks a code of conduct or has a code of conduct that does not forbid harassment. Further domain block decisions will be posted on the admin's feed as a local-only post or discussed on our members-only Discord; an invitation will be made available to new members.
Changes to this Code of Conduct can be tracked on
the dads.cool GitHub repository.

name: snaggletooth.life
aboutMore:
Friendly neighborhood cat here to give you some information on the vibe of this instance if you were interested on signing up. Other instances may have a code of conduct along with a moderation staff to enforce the rules of the community. I've decided not to run this instance that way. On this instance, it's run according to how I want it to run. This doesn't mean it's an unfriendly place or that I rule with an iron fist, it just means that I'm the sole staff person, and that will always be the case. And for rules, they're extremely loose because I like giving people tools to curate their own feeds as opposed to trying to manage everyone's feeds for them.
That being said, I'll give you a quick idea of what sort of things I'm looking to keep off the local and federated feeds here so you can know in advance if you'll fit in or not.
- No Nazis, or really any pro fascist, nationalistic hate rhetoric that exists out there
- We're queer friendly here, so any bigots can find themselves the door out of here
- You would think I could just put, "no racism" here, but a lot of people haven't figured out how to do that yet so I need to say a bit more about it. I'm a white guy, and for some that's an understandable dealbreaker (no hard feelings), but for others I want to stress that I'm gonna do whatever I can to make sure you're comfortable here within reason. If an instance is harassing you repeatedly, they're gone if you let me know. My bullshit capacity is at a all time low. If an instance doesn't want to action their users for their racist bullshit, then I'm not gonna host them here. If it's coming from one of the users here, they're gone. I'm no nonsense and not here to play games or debate those sort of folks. If it bugs you, it'll probably bug me and I'm gonna take care of it regardless of consequences. I don't give a shit about fediverse relationships.
- That being said, if you're someone who tends to get into a lot of petty internet spats, and want someone to look out for you on the home instance, you might want to keep looking. I'm not gonna tolerate any user harassing users of different instances or repeatedly getting into fights with people. I have no issues kicking you out if I'm getting a lot of reports about your behavior. If you're the one being harassed however, and it's clearly evident, I will take action for you in that case.
- I have a pretty lax policy when it comes to content warnings. I don't strictly enforce users to use them, but I do encourage people to use them when posting anything that could be potentially triggering for someone. I advocate users using their judgement here, and expect people to use CWs appropriately. I will not force people to use them. I am not omnipresent and don't particularly wish to try to be, so if you see a user not tagging something that is triggering you, I would ask that you just mute them.
- Speaking of muting people, I really do stress the features given to you by the platform. Instead of posting something you know will start an argument with someone, just block them instead. An entire instance of shitposters is bugging you? Block the whole instance on your own instead of asking me to defederate with them or starting shit with them. I'm not here to manage your feeds when people are annoying or tasteless.
- Really, just use common sense. If you act like an adult and treat other people like adults, you'll have no issues here.
I block instances that have no issues hosting content I do not want to see. A list of some (not all because I'm too lazy to do this for all the tiny ones) blocked instances can be found here:

name: Monster Fuckers
aboutMore:
Welcome to Monster Fuckers
This is a small queer lewd oriented instance that mainly centers around Teratophilia, the love of monsters. If you like twisted beasts, squirmy tentacle friends or are a creature yourself: you are welcome among us! We encourage our users to express their love for the strange and queer, wether it is being in awe or erotic desire.
Rules and Guideline
We do not accept:

Hate Speech, including but not restrained to: queerphobia, transphobia, racism, ableism, slurs, etc.
Illegal content, such as child pornography (including furry cub art) even if only suggestive
Harassment
Doxing
Any instances which does not follow similar rules

Guideline

Users have to be 18+, minors will see their account be terminated
Be kind, respect others even if you disagree with them (within the limits of our rules)
CW your content properly. NSFW content must marked
Have fun
The characters depicted in your stories and art have to be of age & consensual

This text can be changed at anytime

name: Ditt lokale sosiale nettverk â€” oslo.town
aboutMore:
ğŸ‘‹ Welcome
Welcome to a social network of people that were born, live, and work in the Norwegian capital of Oslo.
This website is like Twitter. You can make your own profile, post messages, images, polls, videos, and follow other members.
oslo.town
is owned and operated by people in Oslo. It's free to use and there's no advertising. There's also no big companies trying to monitor your every move.
Sign up now
to claim your unique username.

ğŸ§¬ How does this work?
Just like a real town there is lots of things happening in your local area. When you are signed up, clicking the
Local
/
Lokal
tab will show you everything that is happening on this website. If you want to explore the wider world, click the
Federated
/
Felles
tab to see
everything
happening across a lot of websites connected to this one.
When you see someone interesting,
Follow
/
FÃ¸lg
that person for future updates. They will appear in your
Home
/
Hjem
timeline. You can follow anyone in the whole world - whether they are local or not.
When you see something you didn't want to see, you can
Mute
/
Demp
or
Block
/
BlokkÃ©r
that person or the whole website. If you see something on the local timeline which you don't think should be on the internet, you can
Report
/
RapportÃ©r
it to The Mayor.
For a more geeky insight into how the site works, you can
watch this YouTube video
or
read the Documentation
.
ğŸµï¸ The Mayor
When you sign up to the website, you will instantly be following
@themayor
to get the latest updates straight from the oslo.town town hall. It is
highly recommended
that you follow The Mayor, but it's your life - do what you want - you can always unfollow them.

ğŸ§¢ Merchandise
The lovely people at
@lokk
in Oslo have embroidered a baseball cap.
If you want one, you can go in the store and order one. Ask the for the oslo.town logo
(they might need to search their emails for a reference file)
. Pick out your colour and style of baseball cap. Pay the fine people. And off you go!

ğŸ“œ Code of Conduct
If you want to stick around this place you should just try to be nice to people. As a general rule, that will work fine. Here are some more rules:

No racism, xenophobia, sexism, discrimination, nazis
- If you post offensive stuff then you are going to get banned. Just don't be a dick.

Use the Content Warnings
- Should you feel the need to post some content that might be offensive to someone (explicit nudity, violent or upsetting images, anything you wouldn't like your colleagues to look at) then use the CW feature to hide text and the Sensitive Media checkbox to hide image and video.

No Robots
- If you look, sound,and smell like a robot then you might just get deleted. If you want to be a robot, visit
botsin.space

Post in any language you like
- You don't have to speak Norwegian here, but should expect Norwegians to speak Norwegian and foreigners to speak foreign.

Sign up now
to claim your unique username.

ğŸ™‹ FAQ
Who actually runs this site?
The site is run by the user
@matt
but also pretends to be the character of
@themayor
. This is also why everything is in English so far - his Norwegian sucks. Sorry about that.
How does the site make money?
The site doesn't make money. So long as the site doesn't have hundreds of thousands of users, it isn't very expensive to run. This means it's all paid for by Matt and there is no need to make any money from it. If the cost becomes too much, the site will run on donations.
Speaking of which... if you want to donate via cryptocurrency, you can send it to the following addresses:

Bitcoin (BTC)
Â· 1AvHHTMHnVb6NQ99M182pfWLPziAdbPMTM

Ether (ETH)
Â· 0x6A4471386C4C0404436F7533C686b143fD2B03CC

Bitcoin Cash (BCH)
Â· 1EWfQ6gCv4dVXcGtd6HQwrpp59M3MzoZii

Basic Attention Token (BAT)
Â· 0xa655F3E3f2F77271Ba4D4bDccc335373cC145E83

Dai Stablecoin (DAI)
Â· 0xab4ba46651D292c561609f417d81d37d25289C57

Dash (DASH)
Â· XiEhbq8Nftb4dAYThX3kBjCjZQQEG9Sw9m

Litecoin (LTC)
Â· LcBRPgCRD7arLKhiGEVQw6965bw1tL9Xak

ZCash (ZEC)
Â· t1Zq3L46EJYSMro35nGx6qw1BXC12JVC4XP

Also, if you are using
Brave Web Browser
then you can Tip and Contribute through Brave Rewards as you browse the site.
Why should I use this instead of Facebook / Twitter / etc. ?
Nobody can pretend that
oslo.town
can replace any popular social networking website, but it's meant to be a nicer alternative. Unlike the big social networking sites, we don't collect your data and sell it. You are not a product. The whole point of this site is
community
and being able to connect with people locally and globally.
Is my information private?
The goal is to collect as little information about the users as possible and that when information is collected, it is stored for as short time as possible. If you care to, you can read the full
Privacy Policy
.
To protect your privacy even more, please don't share any personal information with anyone on the site. Think carefully about the username you choose. Share only what you are comfortable sharing.
Do my posts get listed in Google / Bing / another search engine?
In order to protect your privacy, we have opted-out of listing your profile and toots on search engines. You can turn this on yourself in the settings. Please be aware that anyone can still screenshot your toots and sites like
archive.is
or
web.archive.org
could potentially still create a copy of your publicly listed toots.
Nice emoji, huh?
Yeah, we started to use
Mutant Standard emoji
, which are licensed under a
Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License
and made by
@dzuk
.
How do I only see languages I understand?
When you hit the Federated timeline, you will see many users from around the world speaking their native languages. To filter these views to just languages you know, you should
set up the your language preferences
.
How do I get featured on the Explore page?
Simple! To get featured on the
Explore
page, just go to
Edit Profile
and check the box which says
List this account on the directory
.
I see offensive content. Can you block it?
If you see an account you see posting offensive content, please use the
Block and Report
functionality. If this is content that is not hosted on
oslo.town
then check the option which says
Forward to...
which will report the account to the appropriate administrator.
Directly from the offensive post, you can also click the option
Block Domain
which will prevent you from seeing any future content from that website.
The policy at
oslo.town
is as follows:

We will ensure that bad things don't happen on the
Local timeline
.
We attempt to hide (but not block) any NSFW or spam content from the
Federated Timeline
.
We block any external accounts or domains that are known to frequently spamming our users.
Please allow up to 48 hours to process reports.

However, we do not aim to act as your moral compass and will not do domain-wide blocks based on the users of that instance having wild opinions. You should be able to follow anything (even the hidden content) and block these domains or people at your own discretion.
A full list of hidden or blocked domains is published below.
Moderated servers
Mastodon generally allows you to view content from and interact with users from any other server in the fediverse. These are the exceptions that have been made on this particular server.

Fediverse Friendly Moderation Covenant
This instance commits to the following
1. Administration and Moderation will be handled as neutral as possible
Reports and widespread information on specific instances (often known as bad actors) will be verified and actions might be taken as necessary.
2. Actions taken will respond to the bare minimum to keep the network operating and not influence the ability of the instances users to connect to other people

If another instance spreads media content of questionable legality for the region the current instance is operating from, these files might be rejected from being saved.
If another instance is sharing hateful messages that impact local users, there might be consideration of silencing that specific instance from being visible in timelines. If users follow and/or wish to follow users on the target instance, they are still free to do so.
If another instance is posting content illegal in the local instance operation region or actively posts content attacking local users, a full instance block might be the last resort.

3. Communication before Actions
If any of the above behaviours start to surface from a given instance, the moderation of the local instance will attempt to inform the moderation/administration of that instance and resolve the problems coming from there. Only if no communication succeeded or no results that resolved issues came forth, actions will be taken towards that instance.
4. We won't recommend blocks
Blocklists and block recommendations as an information source are taken for granted but lack accurate verification. Instead of using these options to publicly announce instances of questionable intent, we will inform local users of such, with the reminder of possible personal options for hiding content that might impact their experience of the network.
5. No Guilt-by-Association/Federation
If we have applied any action against Instance X, an Instance Y that federates with them will not get the same judgement applied to them. A natural connection, as by the networks design, does not imply shared interests and thus doesn't warrant the same moderation methods.
Regardless of all given points above, in special cases the instance moderation/administration might still opt to block
an instance, while this is tried to be avoided at most.
This Covenant is based on
The Fediverse-Friendly Moderation Covenant
and is licensed under CC0

aboutMore:
About Toot Party

Code of Conduct
The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration and moderation
  of toot.party; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
Excessive advertising
Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and
    revocation of access to the service:
Racism or advocation of racism
Sexism or advocation of sexism
Discrimination against minorities, or advocation thereof
Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
Sexual depictions of children
Content illegal in France and/or Germany, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to
    degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the
    aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to
    the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement
        with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools
        employed.
Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without
        express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for
        said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered
        harassment.


These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access
  permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
Cross-posting
"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does
not
include
  the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps,
  we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.
Cross-posting from Toot Party to other platforms is fully permitted.
Cross-posting into Toot Party from another
  platform is permitted under the following terms
:

The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including
    text from other non-Toot Party users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Toot Party users are not
    ignored
The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Staff

@Arisu
- site owner

We're looking for moderators; contact me via the above email address if you're interested in becoming a moderator of Toot Party.

name: rva.party
aboutMore:
TL;DR: No tolerance for hate. No cops, nationalists, surveillance contractors, etc. We federate with all friendly instances and typically take
Dzuk's advice
on silencing/suspending instances.
The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of rva.party; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
For-profit advertising
Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
Untagged gore and violence, including artistic depictions

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
Hate speech, including racism, sexism, etc., or advocation thereof
Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
Sexual depictions of children
Fascism/nationalism, xenophobia, etc. or advocation thereof
Holocaust denial

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.
This naturally precludes those who work in certain occupations from using the service, namely:
Cops
Spies and spying contractors
Officials involved in planning and carrying out corporate or government surveillance


These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.
Unavailable content
Mastodon generally allows you to view content from and interact with users from any other server in the fediverse. These are the exceptions that have been made on this particular server.

aboutMore:
Things that will get your account closed, possibly without warning

Racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, able-ism etc. (will result in a permanent ban, you may not receive a prior warning)
Anything that could be described as "spam"
Impersonating other people
Harassment of any kind
Bad vibes
We will also block remote accounts that violate these, and instances that don't enforce similar rules.
For any questions, or rules I forgot, send a toot @f0x@pixie.town
Regarding attempts to abuse these anti-abuse tools and policies
Do not attempt to weaponize our Community Standards or anti-abuse tools/policies against marginalized groups such as people of colour, women or queer people. Users of Pixietown are expected to have the literacy to understand that "reverse discrimination" is not real, and so attempts to re-centre discussions of marginalized people around the feelings of the privileged will be taken as manipulative behaviour undertaken deliberately in bad-faith. (E.g. white people should not demand that people of colour put CW's on every discussion of race; a straight person who reports a queer person for writing "I hate straight people" may find their own account suspended.)
Pixietown will suspend any instance launched, acquired or funded by Alphabet, Facebook, Twitter, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, or Elsevier.
We will also suspend any instances using Gab or Soapbox because Fuck Nazis and Fuck TERFS
These are adapted from
Scholar Social's community standards
Moderated servers
Mastodon generally allows you to view content from and interact with users from any other server in the fediverse. These are the exceptions that have been made on this particular server.

Basic principles of this community, allowing a civilized discourse both locally and in fediverse: freedom of speech (we are not a "free speech zone" though!), and freedom to avoid being harmed by other people's speech. In practice, this is implemented by the following rules:

"Civilised discourse" means that racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia etc are not tolerated.
Writing to other people (either by replying to them, or by @-mentioning them) something that they would not like to see is absolutely unacceptable. For example, you should not misgender people, or reply to somebody's toot with "You're a moron", or toot "Turns out @so-and-so is a moron". These are somewhat extreme examples given for illustrative purposes, but you should get the idea. It does not matter whether these messages are marked by CW or not.
If your message can be reasonably assumed to traumatize some other people, hurt their reasonable feelings, or hurt them otherwise, it should be marked by CW describing the topic in question. Some example of CW labels would be, in no specific order or relation: "I was raped", "Gore", "Nudity", "NSFW".
Doxing, outing, publishing personal photos without their subject's consent, CP etc are absolutely forbidden. Violators can be banned permanently on the spot.
And an additional rule...
This Mastodon instance runs on server located in Germany; it is forbidden to violate German laws there.
Note that we do automated daily backups, and that we store last seven backups.

Note that this server will not be shut down permanently for at least 12 months after the moment this notice is still there.

name: kindred.haus
aboutMore:
kindred.haus aims not to be a large or popular instance, but a small one where people can find like-minded friends, where folks can find shelter from an otherwise hostile world. With that said, we follow the general code of conduct listed on the flagship instance,
here
.
Specific considerations:
No nazis, no TERFs, no hatespeech.
Alts and all languages welcome, automated bots are not. Try
botsin.space
if you want to set up your eBooks or other assorted bots.
We are currently running a combined blocklist sourced from
mastodon.social
,
radical.town
and
blockchain
. Similar content to these blocks will also be suspended.
The following guidelines from
sleeping.town
will also be enforced:
Posts containing a piece of art must be credited, ideally with a link back to the source.
Provide appropriate content warnings on potentially sensitive posts and use NSFW tags liberally on adult images, spoilers, and other content that not everyone may want to see.
Current event discussion is permitted but you are highly encouraged to use a current event or politics content-warning

kindred.haus is currently running on a VPS in New Jersey.

name: The Petting Zoo
aboutMore:
The Petting Zoo is a private Mastodon instance run by some queer leaning gay dudes.
No Nazi Shit. No TERFs. No Harassment.
Join our relay!
https://relay.pettingzoo.co/inbox

Code of Conduct
The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of pettingzoo.co; they are here to provide you with an insight into our content moderation policies:

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:
Excessive advertising
Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:
Racism or advocation of racism
Sexism or advocation of sexism
Casteism or advocation of casteism
Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service:
Sexual depictions of children
Content illegal in the United States
Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism

Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also disallowed, and subject to punishment up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:
Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.


These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Special Thanks
Site banner by
nowherebearart
. Find them on
Twitter
and
Tumblr

name: MHz social - mastodon
aboutMore:
Jump:
Welcome !
-
Rules
-
Specs
-
Terms

Welcome !
This is an open Mastodon instance, basically.
It's run by the person you see on the right (that's me!) and for now, that's all.
There might be more admins and moderators later if the needs come but alas not yet.
We runs
Mastodon Glitch Edition
.
I hope this instance works okay for you, and that you can find a nice and welcoming community here! Feel free to hit me up if you have any questions or requests, be it about this instance, how to make your own instance, or other things not related to Mastodon.
I am actually the only sysadmin of this instance and I can't work full-time on mhz.social so, I will do whatever I can in a reasonable time to make it works the best it can.
Rules
This instance has some rules, of course.
First, there are the usual : no sexism, no racism, no hate speech, no LGBTQphobia, no nazis, no spam, no public unflagged porn, etc...
Then, I also believe it's important to remind you that this server was made and is run by a queer activist.
This server thrives to be inclusive, and I will ban without much regret.
People are encouraged to use the report function as they see fit, and can be confident that their complaints will be heard and dealt with in some way. I want everyone to feel safe here, and if that doesn't sound like something you like, you should probably find another server.
This instance, and this entire social network in my opinion, is dedicated to reclaiming social media, decentralizing, and generally creating better and more engaging communities.

Specs
Currently running on
Hetzner Cloud
hardware.
One CX21-CEPH with Nginx, Mastodon WEB, Mastodon Sidekiq and Minio as a S3 assets manager endpoint, PostgreSQL and Redis.
Backups are taken one time per day using the dedicated paid option of Hetzner.

Terms
The server is hosted in Nuremberg
The only logs created are the ones from: nginx, mastodon (nodejs, puma web server, sidekiq) and minio (assets).
There is no retention currently in place except the by-default on Debian.

Rules
Conduct Rules

Respect other users and their backgrounds. Examples of some activities that will not be tolerated are:
Harassment.
Hateful speech.
Being transphobic, racist, fascist, religious intolerants, etc...
Jokes about suicide, self harm.
(And potentially more as we come across specific cases, but you see the picture)

When interacting with
users outside of this server
, you
have
to follow the rules of their server.
For the majority of cases, following our set of rules should be sufficient.
You have to follow proper procedures when posting NSFW content.
If you don't understand what NSFW means,
here's the wikipedia article about it
.
You
must
hide NSFW content using the
Mark media as sensitive
checkbox
You
must
put explicit (Pornographic, genitals, fluid everywhere, etc) content on the
Unlisted
privacy level, or more.
You
may not
have NSFW content in your profiles.

Sexual depictions of children (either drawn or photographed) are not allowed on this server and are considered like pedopornography.
This same rule applies if it is your body, you have to be at least 18 years old to post sexually implying pictures of yourself, no exceptions.
Don't share anyone's personal information without their consent, and delete content about a person should they ask.
For profit companies account aren't allowed. (If you look around a bit there are servers made specifically for this)
Offering sex services in exchange for money is prohibited on the server. (If you look around a bit there are servers made specifically for this)

Boosting
content is the
same as posting
content, if you boost something you endorse it and it must follow these rules.

The Way the Server Works
Politics With Other Servers
"Be conservative in what you send and liberal in what you receive." - Netiquette
We federate with the whole fediverse.
That being said, instances that are a common source of
content that breaks our rules
, or are a
source of nuisance
might be either:

Silenced
, where anyone can follow anyone, but posts will be hidden by default.

Suspended
, which prevents almost all communication with this instance.

If you're managing a server and believe we have silenced or suspended you unfairly, please reach me on my email.

Administration

For security purposes, the staff here have access to more information about the instance users.

Staff
have access to all
Followers-only
posts.

Moderators
are able to access to specific
Direct
posts
only if you report
them.

Administrators
are able to
access all
Direct
posts through the database.
(Not something we usually do, but we want to let you know that Direct posts are
not
a secure communication channel to share, say, your passwords.)

Currently, the website is operated by these wonderful people:

Antoine / Gakamine
